items.title: Amazon’s entire eero Wi-Fi 7 mesh system range on sale for Black Friday: eero 7, Pro, Max, and more from at $128 all-time low
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Black Friday sale, Amazon is currently offering some sweet deals on its entire range of eero 7 mesh Wi-Fi 7 systems, and pretty much everything from the standard eero 7 routers to the latest Outdoor 7 units are discounted at the moment. One of the more notable deals of the lot drops a single-node of its eero 7 mesh Wi-Fi 7 system down to $128.25 shipped. Don’t forget to clip the on-page coupon to secure 5% off to see the discounted price during checkout. This 2025 Wi-Fi 7 mesh router debuted earlier this year with a $170 price tag, which it mostly maintained since release until recently when it hit the $135 mark. By clipping the on-page coupon, however, you can save an additional 5% off to mark a new best price to beat. The dual and triple-node eero 7 systems are also discounted down to $209 and $266 shipped with the same coupon. Head below for more details, along with deals on the entire eero 7 Wi-Fi range.

more…

items.summary:
Running as part of both Lectric’s ongoing Black Friday e-bike Sale, while also bringing the costs down on some of the offers in the parallel Black Friday Battery Sale, the brand has launched a 40% off accessory flash sale that is running for an unknown amount of time. These discounts are dropping a large selection of add-on accessories to their best rates of the year, so you can upgrade your ride even further to suit your needs. You can pick up handy options like the Water-Resistant Pannier Bags down at $45 shipped, upgrade to the Cargo Package with front and rear steel cargo baskets with $98 savings, or start bringing pets along with the Pet Trailer at $179 shipped, among many other options. items.title: Cash in during Lectric’s Black Friday battery sale with up to 30% off new and legacy models starting from $250
items.summary:
Update 11/28: Lectric has increased savings on these extra batteries up to 30% – with prices now starting from $250 through the official holiday, so don’t miss out while they’re around!

As part of its ongoing early Black Friday Sale, Lectric has now launched a Black Friday battery sale with up to 25% savings across a large collection of spare batteries that you can use to double your range and prolong travel times, with prices starting at $270 shipped and ranging up to $595 shipped. Usually for discounts on extra batteries, you’d have to be lucky to catch some of the rare instances of free inclusions, with occasional models getting up to 30% discounts alongside e-bike purchases, but again, these are rare occurrences. While this side sale continues you’ll be able to grab one for any XP4, XPeak, XPedition, XPress, XP Lite, ONE, and older XP 3.0 e-bikes you already own with up to $211 in savings at some of their best prices. Head below to check out the full lineup while they’re still around.

One such standout is Segway’s latest E3 Pro Electric Scooter down at $499.99 shipped, and which seems to have disappeared from Amazon’s marketplace. Carrying a $700 MSRP since launching back at the top of October, we’ve only seen this model given $100 price cuts in its launch deal and the brand’s Halloween and early Black Friday sales. Now, with things having ramped up with increased savings now that Black Friday is in full swing, you can score a larger-than-ever $200 markdown to a new all-time low price, giving you an advanced upgrade to your commute that I have been loving so far since getting one a short time ago.
